comment: published as having steppe ancestry, but not enough SNPs for statistical significance

manual check ancestry: could genuinly be steppe; very few SNPs; a possible model is Iron Gates HG (43%) + CHG (41%) + EHG (16%) (p=0.70), although CHG + Latvian HG also possible (p=0.73)
outlier?: this is the only individual in the time slice >3500BC that has steppe/Yamnaya-like ancestry. A technical artifact is possible (contamination estimates indicate no problem, but there are very few SNPs), also models only involving various HG groups, but without more data one has to conclude for the time being that this is the first actual occurrence of Yam-like ancestry in our data set

outlier?: at ~12% it's impossible to say if Yam-like ancestry is there due to migration, or if it's rather just a geographic phenomenon due to spatial gene-flow
column18: doesn't terribly matter for our analysis, but if you go for 'outliers', based on ancestry alone I'd rather choose the ones with more Yam-like ancestry below
